intro: Valdivia gayana var. robusta, commonly known as the robusta valdivia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Paraguay. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with thick, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
